result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Thomas Tracy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
1) The defendant shall pay at a rate of $200 per month until these obligations are satisfied in full.
2) All payments are ordered to be paid to the BURNETT COUNTY CLERK OF COURT'S OFFICE.  The defendant has thirty (30) days to make payment of any amount ordered unless other arrangements are made with the Clerk of Court's office. Make checks or money orders payable to "BURNETT COUNTY" and send to: Burnett County Clerk of Court, 7410 Cty. Rd. K,  #115, Siren, WI 54872.    
Payments may be made either in person, by mail, or online either through wicourts.gov or through paygov.us. (subject to each website's processing fees). 
3) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

10:08 AM Defendant Steven Thomas Tracy in court.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Steven Thomas Tracy.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Taber: def pleading to amended Ct 1 of misdemeanor possession of amphetamine, 1 yr probation, w/h sentence, programming per DOC, AODA, costs. Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  State moves to amend Count 1 as stated; granted by Court.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of amended Count 1 and orders a JOC.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement, notes 1 day jail credit.  Def makes a statement to the Court.  
Court orders:
$443 court costs; def to make payments of $200 per month until paid in full.  First payment due by 9/30/22.  1 day jc  1 day jail. 
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.

9:12 AM Defendant Steven Thomas Tracy in court.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Steven Thomas Tracy.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: resolved w/ plea to misdemeanor amphetamine count.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Only judge may quash this warrant unless the cash bond is posted in full.
